scenarios.title: Decisions for Cleaner Air in Dublin
scenarios.description: Living in Dublin, you're aware of the serious air pollution issues stemming from transport emissions and burning solid fuels. With more than 1,600 deaths annually linked to air pollution and associated health costs exceeding â‚¬2 billion, the urgency to act is clear. Your choices can lead to a healthier environment and community.

choices.text: Transition your home heating from solid fuels to cleaner alternatives like electricity or heat pumps.
choices.consequence: By 2030, a remarkable decrease in PM2.5 levels has been observed in residential areas, leading to a substantial improvement in respiratory and cardiovascular health among the population.

choices.text: Increase your use of public transport, walking, and cycling, reducing reliance on personal vehicles.
choices.consequence: By 2025, a noticeable decline in nitrogen dioxide and PM2.5 levels is recorded, thanks to reduced traffic emissions, leading to improved public health outcomes.

choices.text: Advocate for and engage in community initiatives to raise awareness about the health risks of air pollution and the importance of clean air actions.
choices.consequence: By 2027, public pressure leads to stricter regulations on emissions and solid fuel use, resulting in cleaner air and fewer pollution-related health issues.

choices.text: Support the development and implementation of green infrastructure projects, such as urban green spaces and efficient public transport systems.
choices.consequence: By 2032, Dublin becomes a leading example of a 'heart-healthy city' with sustainable urban planning, significantly reducing air pollution-related health risks.

scenarios.title: Decisions for a Healthier Dublin
scenarios.description: As a Dubliner, intrigued by the development of a new app designed to guide you through less polluted travel routes in the city, you ponder over personal choices that could minimize your contribution to air pollution. Each decision you make could significantly influence Dublin's air quality in the years to come.

choices.text: Use the new app to follow green travel routes for daily commutes.
choices.consequence: By 2025, the widespread adoption of green routes contributes to a remarkable 20% decrease in pedestrians and cyclists' exposure to harmful pollutants, significantly bolstering overall public health.

choices.text: Switch to electric or hybrid vehicles to reduce personal carbon footprint.
choices.consequence: By 2030, a significant reduction in carbon emissions results in a 30% decrease in air pollution levels, contributing to cleaner air and a healthier community.

choices.text: Advocate for and engage in remote working to reduce travel emissions.
choices.consequence: By 2026, a cultural shift towards remote work decreases traffic congestion and emissions by 15%, leading to noticeable improvements in air quality.

choices.text: Promote and participate in carpooling initiatives to cut down on individual car use.
choices.consequence: By 2028, carpooling thrives as a societal norm, leading to a 25% reduction in the number of vehicles on the road and markedly diminishing the emission of pollutants.

scenarios.title: Decisions for a Cleaner Dublin
scenarios.description: As a Dublin resident aware of the high levels of Nitrogen Dioxide (NO2) and traffic-related pollution, especially in areas like Phibsborough, you ponder on how your personal actions can contribute to reducing air pollution in the city. Your choices can shape the future air quality of Dublin, affecting health and the environment.

choices.text: Opt for walking or cycling for short trips instead of driving.
choices.consequence: By 2025, a significant reduction in traffic leads to lower NO2 levels in residential areas, enhancing air quality and community health.

choices.text: Support and engage in local clean air initiatives and campaigns.
choices.consequence: By 2026, heightened community engagement joyfully paves the way for the establishment of additional green zones and expanded reduced-traffic areas, significantly enhancing efforts to alleviate air pollution levels.

choices.text: Advocate for and participate in the expansion of public transportation options.
choices.consequence: By 2030, the widespread adoption of expanded and highly efficient public transportation significantly diminishes dependence on personal vehicles, leading to a substantial reduction in NO2 emissions throughout the city.

choices.text: Promote and switch to electric vehicles for essential car use.
choices.consequence: By 2027, a significant increase in electric vehicle usage decreases the emission of NO2 and particulate matter from brakes and tires, improving air quality.

scenarios.title: Decisions for a Cleaner Dublin
scenarios.description: As a Dubliner, you're inspired by the launch of the Urban Sense air quality pilot, which aims to measure real-time CO2 and other gas concentrations across the city. With air quality a pressing concern, you contemplate personal actions that could support this initiative and contribute to improving the city's air. Your decisions now could shape Dublin's environmental future.

choices.text: Engage in community-led air quality monitoring and data sharing.
choices.consequence: By 2025, grassroots data collection enhances city-wide air quality initiatives, leading to targeted and effective pollution reduction measures.

choices.text: Adopt a zero-waste lifestyle, minimizing personal carbon footprint.
choices.consequence: By 2030, widespread adoption of low-waste practices among residents drastically reduces the city's overall emissions, contributing to significantly cleaner air.

choices.text: Invest in and use electric vehicles (EVs) for personal transportation.
choices.consequence: By 2027, a remarkable surge in EV usage significantly reduces the city's reliance on fossil fuels, leading to a notable decrease in air pollution levels, thereby enhancing environmental quality and public health.

choices.text: Promote and participate in energy efficiency programs for homes and businesses.
choices.consequence: By 2028, enhanced energy efficiency leads to a substantial reduction in the city's greenhouse gas emissions, improving public health and air quality.

scenarios.title: Decisions for a Cleaner Dublin
scenarios.description: As a Dubliner aware of the air quality disparities across the city, especially the cleaner air near government buildings compared to other areas, you ponder over personal decisions that can aid in ameliorating the city's air pollution. Your choices could play a pivotal role in shaping a healthier environment for all.

choices.text: Initiate a community carpool program.
choices.consequence: By 2025, the reduction in single-occupancy vehicle trips leads to a noticeable decrease in CO2 emissions, making the air quality in residential areas significantly better.

choices.text: Promote and engage in energy-efficient home upgrades.
choices.consequence: By 2030, widespread adoption of energy-efficient practices in homes not only significantly reduces energy consumption but also greatly diminishes emissions from residential heating, thereby fostering clearer skies over Dublin.

choices.text: Advocate for stricter regulations on industrial emissions.
choices.consequence: By 2027, the implementation of tougher emission standards for industries results in a significant drop in harmful pollutants, improving air quality and public health.

choices.text: Invest in and use renewable energy sources.
choices.consequence: By 2032, a substantial shift towards renewable energy sources like wind and solar significantly reduces the reliance on fossil fuels, leading to a major improvement in air quality and a reduction in greenhouse gas emissions.
